name: Cheesy Mexican Spoon Bread
author: lissalou22
summary: I grew up eating this with chili on cold Colorado nights! This is a great alternative for plain old cornbread as a side!
ingredients: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped mild green chiles, drained
1 ½ cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk together cornmeal, salt, and baking soda in a large bowl
Stir in milk and vegetable oil until well blended
Beat in egg and cream-style corn until well mixed
Pour half of the batter into the prepared pan, then sprinkle with half of the green chilies and half of the Monterey Jack cheese
Repeat the layers, ending with remaining cheese
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes
